metadata.title: CVE-2023-5367 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A out-of-bounds write flaw was found in the xorg-x11-server. This issueoccurs due to an incorrect calculation of a buffer offset when copying datastored in the heap in the XIChangeDeviceProperty function inXi/xiproperty.c and in RRChangeOutputProperty function inrandr/rrproperty.c, allowing for possible escalation of privileges ordenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5367` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
xserver-common - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
xvfb - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7~22.04.2').
xwayland package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.7').
